intro: Tetradymia glabrata, commonly known as the smooth tetradymia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellowish-green. Tetradymia glabrata is often found in open grasslands and along dry streambeds.
